required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of a Natural Ingredient on Appetite Regulation
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of Efficacy of a Natural Ingredient on Appetite Regulation in Overweight / Obese Patients Grade I

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

clinical_study.source: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

brief_summary.textblock: Single-center, double-blind, double-crossed, randomized controlled clinical trial with two crossed branches, designed with the objective of evaluating the effect of the investigational product on satiety.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects who meet the selection criteria will make a total of five visits to the research laboratory and will carry out the tests established in the protocol. Subsequently, a statistical analysis will be performed with the variables measured in the study to obtain results.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: It is measured twice, both at the end of taking the product after 60 days (placebo and experimental product)
primary_outcome.description: Satiety assessment, measured in eva scale (%)

primary_outcome.measure: Sensation of appetite before intaking the product under investigation
primary_outcome.time_frame: It is measured twice, both at the end of taking the product after 60 days (placebo and experimental product)
primary_outcome.description: Satiety assessment, measured in eva scale (%)

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve of the evolution of the appetite sensation from instant zero ingestion to instant ingestion of 60 minutes
primary_outcome.time_frame: It is measured twice, both at the end of taking the product after 60 days (placebo and experimental product)
primary_outcome.description: Satiety assessment, measured in eva scale (%)

primary_outcome.measure: Average of the appetite sensation during the 60 minutes after intake of the experimented product
primary_outcome.time_frame: It is measured twice, both at the end of taking the product after 60 days (placebo and experimental product)
primary_outcome.description: Satiety assessment, measured in eva scale (%)

primary_outcome.measure: Decrease in the sensation of appetite suffering from subjects when consuming the product in experimentation
primary_outcome.time_frame: It is measured twice, both at the end of taking the product after 60 days (placebo and experimental product)
primary_outcome.description: Satiety assessment, measured in eva scale (%)

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve of the evolution of the appetite feeling from the 60 minutes post-intake instantly 240 minutes post-intake.
primary_outcome.time_frame: It is measured twice, both at the end of taking the product after 60 days (placebo and experimental product)
primary_outcome.description: Satiety assessment, measured in eva scale (%)

primary_outcome.measure: Appetite sensation at 240 minutes post-ingestion and area under the curve of the evolution of appetite feeling from instant zero post-intake to instant 240 minutes post-intake
primary_outcome.time_frame: It is measured twice, both at the end of taking the product after 60 days (placebo and experimental product)
primary_outcome.description: Satiety assessment, measured in eva scale (%)

primary_outcome.measure: Appetite feeling immediately after ad-libitum food
primary_outcome.time_frame: It is measured twice, both at the end of taking the product after 60 days (placebo and experimental product)
primary_outcome.description: Satiety assessment, measured in eva scale (%)

primary_outcome.measure: Amount of energy consumed during the ad-libitum meal
primary_outcome.time_frame: It is measured twice, both at the end of taking the product after 60 days (placebo and experimental product)
primary_outcome.description: Satiety assessment, measured in kcal with the weighing of the food consumed in the ad libitum test

primary_outcome.time_frame: It is measured twice, both at the end of taking the product after 60 days (placebo and experimental product)
primary_outcome.description: Satiety assessment, measured in kcal with the weighing of the food consumed in the ad libitum test

secondary_outcome.description: Bioimpedance, in Kg. For this we will use a TANITA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: It will be measured for 3 days before and after the consumption time (60 days) with the experimental product and the placebo product.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured in MET, with Actigraph wGT3X-BT

It is measured before and after the consumption time (60 days) with the experimental product and the placebo product.

secondary_outcome.description: It is a blood test that measures the presence of some enzymes, proteins and bilirubin in the blood, with the aim of determining if there is any alteration in the liver. Enzyme GPT, GOT, Gamma GT, LDH, alkaline phosphatase and bilirubin (UI/L)

arm_group.description: Consumption for 60 days of Lippia citriodora 325 mg + Hibiscus sabdariffa 175 mg. Two capsules per day will be consumed thirty minutes before breakfast orally for 60 days.
Two capsules per day will be consumed thirty minutes before breakfast orally for 60 days.

intervention.description: The experimental product consumption time was 60 days and the control consumption time was 60 days. Each subject must consume both products, with a washing period of 30 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-65 years.
- Both genders.
- BMI 25-34.9 kg / m2, both inclusive.
- Weight maintained during the last 3 months.
- Smoking subjects or not, but in any case they do not change their nicotinic habits during their participation in the study.
- Absence of disease diagnosed at the start of the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Thyroid dysfunction, infections, or with any type of chronic disease (eg, autoimmune, inflammatory).
- History of allergic hypersensitivity or poor tolerance to any component of the products under study.
- Subjects who are performing or intend to carry out any type of diet, low-calorie or not, during the study.
- Participation in another clinical trial in the three months prior to the study.
- Lack of will or inability to comply with clinical trial procedures.
- Pregnant woman.
- Subjects whose condition does not make them eligible for the study according to the researcher's criteria.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia
